Details: Two fundamentally different but complementary outputs addressing MarkLogic-to-MongoDB migration. Python_Script provides executable validation code with database connections and CRUD operations. Reconciliation_Report provides analytical documentation with migration challenges and recommendations. Both serve the migration validation goal but through different approaches - implementation vs analysis.

Both outputs address MarkLogic-to-MongoDB migration validation but with fundamentally different approaches. Python_Script focuses on technical implementation with executable functions for database operations (lines 5-140). Reconciliation_Report provides strategic analysis with migration challenges and recommendations (lines 10-110). Semantic alignment is low due to different output types - code vs documentation - despite shared migration validation purpose.

Completely different structural approaches. Python_Script follows standard code structure: imports (lines 1-3), function definitions (lines 5-120), main execution (lines 122-150). Reconciliation_Report uses markdown documentation structure: headers, subsections, code examples, bullet points (lines 1-120). No structural overlap between executable code and analytical report formats.
